message.body: It was nice seeing you earlier today!
Oh yeah. Pleasant surprise!
You feeling better after your car situation?
Yeah. Are you?
That's awesome.
I know! I didn't know you were a temple person. Are you Buddhist?
Oh yea, completely better! I got my car back :)
oh haha..so you’re Buddholic
I would consider myself Buddhist since my mom is and we grew up with it. However, I was enrolled in Catholic schools for 14 years so that kind of rubber off on me hahah.
Thanks!
Hahah nice! Do you go often?
yeah once a week there or in south jersey near my parents house. You?
Wow, quite devoted huh? I don't go that often, the last time I was there was for the Lunar New Year and I got an allergic reaction to the incense :(
oh yeah. i’m actually not a big fan of incense.
well, i go to pray for people i know that need help.
oh cool. i want to try to go to another one that’s more refined.
I don't mind the aroma but i think it's the smoke. I like going once in a while, like today, it was nice. We actually went to another temple afterwards.
That's very generous and caring. Do you attend the service?
yeah. but i don’t know the doctrines or can remember them. i studied english translations of the principles.
oh ok. i hear there’s one in chinatown and a thai buddhist temple on washington.
Well there's one on 4th street and another one in Lansdale.
That I know of.
Me either, I'm not sure what they're saying most of the time.
I'm pretty sure we could just google this hahah
i know lol
i have a few buddhist ebooks on my phone
are you still interested in getting an MBA?
Really?! What are they about?
The 4 Noble Truths.

That's my most recent consideration for grad school. I think it'll be the most practical/useful. I just don't know enough about it. There are a lot of options for a Masters in Business. It's overwhelming.
oh yeah
Moreover, I'm pretty sure i'm more knowledgeable about an M.A. in my major field of study, so I was more serious about that.9
Masters In Arts?
Yup. Then again, I think an M.B.A. would be more useful.
yeah. MBA is still a good standard.
but it really depends what you want to do..
and you wanna look at the ROI
I agree, I have to look at it long term.
what i did was i worked for a company that paid for it 100%
it took awhile to find a company. but it was worth it.
That's my ideal situation! Good for you, I think it'll totally be worth it.
http://www.nopaymba.com/
she was covered in Philly recently
you can also use this http://www.nopaymba.com/no-pay-mba-calculator/
Whoa, thank you!
yep
haha
you know that person or just some funny pic?
Hahah!
Random funny pic from Facebook.
oh ok
Yea, I don't use Tindr.
*Tinder
oh is that Tinder?
do you do investments like mutual funds or stocks?
Yup, I think that's where it's from.
No, but I want to look into investing in stocks later on.
Do you think it's better to have a portfolio manager or just manage it yourself?
ok. so, i had a portfolio manager for years, and if i could do it all over again. i should have just managed it myself
and i recently did that.
they charge a lot and do very little. it’s actually not that hard once you learn about it.
and they will only sell or tell you to buy things that their companies or they are licensed to do.
Oh okay. Good to know.
since i’ve been educating myself and learning a lot more. i find there are so many other investment vehicles and strategies they didn’t inform me about.
Yeah, my brother-in-law did that too. He started to manage it himself and it did better.
yeah. and you learn a lot.
b/c they charge, it affects your growth and compound interests
How do they charge you? Is it a commission system or do they take a percentage off of your gain?
depends.
some are flat fee
some take a commission based on your total assets..not your gain
Right.
so there’s always a conflict of interest..so theoretically, they could do nothing and just take fees.
their risk is low, they get paid of your commission..but it’s your money at risk.
if you take the risk, you should take the reward.
if everyone is shared in the reward, everyone should take on risk, not just you ..
Exactly.
yeah. exactly
I also wonder about priorities. I'm sure one person is managing multiple portfolios so their attention is split and there are missed opportunities.
Vanguard is good actually. they charge very little only based on dividends
if you have a certain about in their account
their agents are paid on a salary basis and it’s through the phone. so their expenses are low.
What do you think about bonds?
i’m a big believer in MOOC and i’m glad to see someone vetting it http://www.nopaymba.com/employers-think-mooc-education-ceos-open-letter-mooc-mba-students/
bonds are ok. it’s good to have a few as sorta “savings” and hedge against inflation
but when you’re young. your goal is to build cash as fast as possible
this way they can compound
I was thinking about investing in that first when the time comes.
But the benefits are not potentially as great as stocks.
And it seems less risky.
so when the market is down, bonds go up.
but i feel that when the market is down, it’s when you actually buy stocks at a lower price
bonds are good..maybe put 3-10% in bonds just for asset protection
also, regardless, just start investing you’ll learn a lot and its fun.
yeah. i used to be nervous about it. but when you learn more and do tons of more research and diversify. it’s not so bad,
Hahah it's fun in a masochistic sort of way. I'm pretty sure my heart rate would go up and I'll be on edge a lot more.
Jeez, you should teach a class!
i did
i’m still learning about investments though.
the cool thing is you’ll start paying attention to more worldly news and see how they affect stocks

for example, there’s a proxy oil war against Russia and Iran to bankrupt them. Foreign countries including US lower their prices to bankrupt Russia and Iran b/c they can’t compete on those prices..that’s why gas is so low, but b/c oil prices are low, price of Energy stocks are down..
the best place to invest in my opinion, is your thirst to learn and apply knowledge.
and invest in your health.
I believe that you taught, you sounds like a professor.
Especially this accounting professor I had this past summer.
oh nice. actually, i wanted to go into teaching..i teach classes sometimes at UPenn
guest
i’ve taught classes on programming, internet commerce strategies
Cool, are you an adjunct?
i love it. i think eventually when i retire, i’ll become a professor
Serious stuff.
That's what my plan is too!
cool. what did she/he say?
I actually asked my Economics professor about becoming/being a professor.
oh cool.
i almost decided to get my Phd
but i realized it stands for Phake Doctor.
Hahah!
I heard it's a "Playa Hater Degree".
yep
In what field did you think about getting it in?
organizational development
management
i was also interested in getting into robotics
i think its the future
especially in healthcare
quite possibiby
Do you believe in the Singularity?
Kurzweil has been right a lot of times
Doesn't it freak you out?
uh. yeah. kinda. but who knows
i’m more interested in benefits of healthcare and longevity
But how long do you want to live?
as long as i’m healthy, long as possible
How would you want robotics to affect healthcare?
Surgical procedures?
yeah. help out around the house.
help bathe.
Hahah! Sounds like you want a robot housekeeper.
yep :-)
Got a Roomba yet?
nah. i have a lot of steps at my place
Oh that would be a problem. You would have to build legs for your Roomba.
Or wings!!!
Build wings!
hammy......you’re right about
i can build a drone roomba
a Droomba
Hahahah! Droomba TM.
yep
That would be fantastic!
I'm excited.
Oh how was Thanksgiving in AC?
how it was nice. went to a vietnamese concert in AC that was actually pretty fun.
haha..i have no idea who they are
You like those concerts don't you?
Hahah I don't know most if them when go too either.
My mom just asked me earlier if I wanted to go to one at Harrah's on the 27th.
oh cool. the one Tom works at?
Yes.
